p: To you I lift up my soul, O my God
In you I have trusted; let me not be put to shame.
Nor let my enemies exult over me;
and let none who hope in you be put to shame.
O God, who gladden us each year with the feast day of your handmaid Saint Cecilia,
grant, we pray, that what has been devoutly handed down concerning her
may offer us examples to imitate and proclaim the wonders worked in his servants by Christ your Son.
Who lives and reigns with you in the unity of the Holy Spirit, God, for ever and ever.
Accept, we pray, O Lord these offerings we make,
gathered from among your gifts to us,
and may what you grant us to celebrate devoutly here below
gain for us the prize of eternal redemption.
